meanings.definition: A radioactive metallic chemical element with the symbol Th and atomic number 90.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study thorium to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent2: Miners extracted thorium from the earth for industrial use.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook thorium for a shiny nut!
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as powerful as thorium, resonating through the room.
meanings.sent5: The glow of thorium in the dark was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A naturally occurring element found in small amounts in rocks and soils.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use fertilizers containing thorium to enrich the soil.
meanings.sent2: Geologists analyze the presence of thorium in geological samples.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly added thorium instead of salt to the soup!
meanings.sent4: His smile was as rare and precious as thorium in nature.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset reflected the colors of thorium in the rocks.
